explanation: The hands of the clock move first one and two quarters, then two and three quarters.
The shapes add together, or cancel out if they are the same.
Each column have the same patterns but in different layers.
The shapes add together, or cancel out if they are the same.
The first and third shapes are the same. After a black dot, the following image loses a black area.
The same lines cancel out. Different lines produce a solid line.
Every iteration horizontal lines are removed from the lower boxes.
The quarter circles rotates 90 degrees every iteration, alternating which parts of it are visible.
All rows have the same three images but in a different order.
Horizontal line goes to the other end and shrinks.
All rows have arrows that point right, left, and both ways.
All rows have a circle, square, and diamond, and dots that go from one to three vertically.
The circle gets darkened by the grey section, which expands to the right.
The shape rotates 90 degrees clockwise, inversing its color. The amount shown is also altered.
Ignore the middle column. The last row has the patterns switched.
